usage: A chest for players to store and take treasures
interactivity: its hinged lid could be opened
interactionDeduction: Users will approach the treasure chest and use their hands to make contact with the lid. The interaction will likely involve a pressing motion to push down on the lid, followed by a pulling motion to lift it open. The chest's wooden texture will provide a tactile feedback, and users may feel the resistance of the hinged lid as they open it. The interaction is expected to be momentary as they quickly access the contents inside.

usage: players will use it to open a tresure chest
interactionDeduction: Users will grasp the key using a precision grip, holding it between their thumb and index finger. The smooth texture of the key will be felt as they manipulate it. The interaction will involve a turning motion as they insert the key into the lock of the treasure chest, followed by a twisting action to unlock it. This requires careful control and dexterity, as users will need to ensure the key aligns properly with the lock.

usage: players will use it to smash things
inertia: relatively heavy with the center of mass concentrated at one end
interactionDeduction: Users will grasp the hammer using a power grip, wrapping their hand around the round handle. The relatively heavy weight, with the center of mass concentrated at one end, will require users to adjust their grip for balance. The interaction will involve a swinging motion to lift the hammer and then a downward smashing motion aimed at a target. Users will feel the inertia as they swing and the impact feedback when the hammer strikes an object, simulating a realistic hammering experience.

usage: players will punch it for blowing off steam
outline: the punching bag is positioned on the ground. make sure a proxy's volume covers this punching bag
hardness: feeling a little bit soft while punching
interactionDeduction: Users will approach the scarecrow punching bag and use their fists to make contact. The interaction will involve a punching motion, where users will strike the bag with their fists. The bag is expected to feel a little soft upon impact, providing a slight give that simulates a real punching experience. Users may engage in sustained contact as they repeatedly punch the bag, feeling the feedback of their strikes and the slight movement of the bag as it absorbs the impact.
